string.ID:

You can penetrate armor multiple times, though, and each time you penetrate, you deal the weapon's damage.
Let's equip it.

string.ID: The whole game world is a series of contiguous maps. Our passage continues off screen. Let's follow it. Walk north.

strings.string: ▶The whole game world is a series of contiguous maps. Our passage continues off screen. Let's follow it. Walk north.

string.ID:
Oh! it looks like Warden Yrame killed Mehmet. Why, you ask?
Well, named creatures who you can perform the water ritual with, like Mehmet, generate with dynamic faction relationships. In your game, Mehmet must have been hated by the Fellowship of Wardens for some reason.
string.Value:
▶Oh! it looks like Warden Yrame killed Mehmet. Why, you ask?
Well, named creatures who you can perform the water ritual with, like Mehmet, generate with dynamic faction relationships. In your game, Mehmet must have been hated by the Fellowship of Wardens for some reason.

string.ID:
And so Warden Yrame took her revenge. In Qud, sometimes even our best efforts at providing a safe starter village are foiled by the simulation!
What a charmed run! It's quite rare for this to happen, but now you get to see this hidden section of the tutorial. Good job.
string.Value:
▶And so Warden Yrame took her revenge. In Qud, sometimes even our best efforts at providing a safe starter village are foiled by the simulation!
What a charmed run! It's quite rare for this to happen, but now you get to see this hidden section of the tutorial. Good job.

string.ID:
You have a few options now. You can roll with it and continue in this world where Mehmet's been revenge-slain. The early game will be a bit harder, but the main quest is not impacted.
You can start over and play the tutorial again, for the "normal" ending, which you were about to reach.
Or, since you were near the end anyway, you can start a new game and begin your journey proper!
string.Value:
▶You have a few options now. You can roll with it and continue in this world where Mehmet's been revenge-slain. The early game will be a bit harder, but the main quest is not impacted.
You can start over and play the tutorial again, for the "normal" ending, which you were about to reach.
Or, since you were near the end anyway, you can start a new game and begin your journey proper!

string.ID:
Whatever you choose, good luck, and feel free to return here for a refresher.
Live and drink.
string.Value:
▶Whatever you choose, good luck, and feel free to return here for a refresher.
Live and drink.

string.ID:
Quetzal! That's all for the tutorial, friend.
We just scratched the very tip of the surface. Quests, secrets, leveling up, physics, reputation, limbs... we leave that for you to discover.
string.Value:
▶Quetzal! That's all for the tutorial, friend.
We just scratched the very tip of the surface. Quests, secrets, leveling up, physics, reputation, limbs... we leave that for you to discover.

string.ID: You're ready to continue the journey on your own, but don't hesitate to play the tutorial again if you need a refresher.

strings.string: ▶You're ready to continue the journey on your own, but don't hesitate to play the tutorial again if you need a refresher.

string.ID:
Whoever this was, they had some books. All books can be read in game.
Books with {{Y|white}} titles are generated and usually contain nonsense, but the nonsense can occasionally be useful.
Books with {{W|gold}} titles are more valuable: they are handwritten by in-world beings and contain interesting takes on the world.

Books with {{W|gold}} titles are more valuable: they are handwritten by in-world beings and contain interesting takes on the world.

string.ID: This water is valuable too. Take it all.

string.ID:
Welcome to the Caves of Qud tutorial. We'll just be scratching the surface here, learning enough of the basics to help you get your footing.
In Caves of Qud, you play as a mutated human or true kin.
For the tutorial, we're picking mutated human.
string.Value:
▶Welcome to the Caves of Qud tutorial. We'll just be scratching the surface here, learning enough of the basics to help you get your footing.
In Caves of Qud, you play as a mutated human or true kin.
For the tutorial, we're picking mutated human.

string.ID:
Character creation is a deep and sometimes long process. We included some preset builds to help you get started. After the tutorial, you can try another build, or make a character from scratch. (The recommended way! Once you get your footing.)
For now, pick the marsh taur.
string.Value:
▶Character creation is a deep and sometimes long process. We included some preset builds to help you get started. After the tutorial, you can try another build, or make a character from scratch. (The recommended way! Once you get your footing.)
For now, pick the marsh taur.

string.ID: Here is a summary of your attributes and mutations, which grant your character unique abilities.

strings.string: ▶Here is a summary of your attributes and mutations, which grant your character unique abilities.

string.ID: You can name your character or choose Next for a random name.

strings.string: ▶You can name your character or choose Next for a random name.

string.ID: On the 30th of Kisu Ux, you scuttle down a dark shaft at the edge of a sunken trade path and arrive at a caravanserai. It's powdered in salt and dust from across the ribbon of time.

strings.string: ▶On the 30th of Kisu Ux, you scuttle down a dark shaft at the edge of a sunken trade path and arrive at a caravanserai. It's powdered in salt and dust from across the ribbon of time.

string.ID: In %=year=%, Rebekah died of glotrot, and on her deathbed Resheph forgave her and absolved her of sin. He allowed her to be buried in the village of Ezra, outside the gate to the Tomb of the Eaters and beneath the shadow of the Spindle.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, Rebekah died of glotrot, and on her deathbed Resheph forgave her and absolved her of sin. He allowed her to be buried in the village of Ezra, outside the gate to the Tomb of the Eaters and beneath the shadow of the Spindle.

string.ID: In %=year=%, Resheph appointed Rebekah administrator of =region=. She tendered alms for the sick in his name.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, Resheph appointed Rebekah administrator of =region=. She tendered alms for the sick in his name.

string.ID: Acting against a prohibition on the practice of worshipping the stars, Resheph led an army to the gates of Omonporch. There he defeated his brothers in battle and liberated its citizens, and they crowned him the sultan of Qud.

strings.string: ▶Acting against a prohibition on the practice of worshipping the stars, Resheph led an army to the gates of Omonporch. There he defeated his brothers in battle and liberated its citizens, and they crowned him the sultan of Qud.

string.ID: In %=year=%, Rebekah betrayed Resheph by stealing the Mark of Death from the gate to the Tomb of the Eaters. In punishment, Resheph excommunicated her from the sultanate.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, Rebekah betrayed Resheph by stealing the Mark of Death from the gate to the Tomb of the Eaters. In punishment, Resheph excommunicated her from the sultanate.

string.ID: In %=year=%, Resheph cleansed the marshlands of the plagues of the Gyre and taught Abram to sow watervine along its fertile tracks.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, Resheph cleansed the marshlands of the plagues of the Gyre and taught Abram to sow watervine along its fertile tracks.

string.ID: In %=year=%, Resheph closed the gates to the Tomb of the Eaters, abdicated the throne, and dissolved the sultanate in order to lift the curse of the Gyre.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, Resheph closed the gates to the Tomb of the Eaters, abdicated the throne, and dissolved the sultanate in order to lift the curse of the Gyre.

string.ID: In %=year=%, Resheph, the Above, Ghost-in-Cerulean, the Coiled Lamb of Baetyls, died of natural causes. He was 216 years old.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, Resheph, the Above, Ghost-in-Cerulean, the Coiled Lamb of Baetyls, died of natural causes. He was 216 years old.

string.ID: After conferring with mysterious strangers, Resheph convinced them to help him found a harborage for the purpose of receiving visitors from across the clustered cosmos. They named it Starfarer's Quay.

strings.string: ▶After conferring with mysterious strangers, Resheph convinced them to help him found a harborage for the purpose of receiving visitors from across the clustered cosmos. They named it Starfarer's Quay.

string.ID: While traveling alone through the Rust Wells, Resheph came across a trove of gleaming stars in a bottle. From that day forth, he always kept some stardust on his person.

strings.string: ▶While traveling alone through the Rust Wells, Resheph came across a trove of gleaming stars in a bottle. From that day forth, he always kept some stardust on his person.

string.ID: In %=year=%, the Gyre widened, and the first triad of plagues afflicted the land. The water was poisoned with salt, girshlings ravaged the fruit and wheat, and tongues rotted away in the mouths of kith and kin. Resheph walked below the chrome arches and healed the sick.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, the Gyre widened, and the first triad of plagues afflicted the land. The water was poisoned with salt, girshlings ravaged the fruit and wheat, and tongues rotted away in the mouths of kith and kin. Resheph walked below the chrome arches and healed the sick.

string.ID: In %=year=%, the Gyre widened, and the second triad of plagues afflicted the land. The legs of kith and kin annealed to iron, darkness bloomed from the earth, and the svardym blackened the sky. Resheph walked below the chrome arches and healed the sick.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, the Gyre widened, and the second triad of plagues afflicted the land. The legs of kith and kin annealed to iron, darkness bloomed from the earth, and the svardym blackened the sky. Resheph walked below the chrome arches and healed the sick.

string.ID: One starry evening, a babe was found swaddled with its mouth full of circuits by a group of baetyls in Red Rock. They took him into their fold and fostered him, and he became known as Resheph, the Coiled Lamb of Baetyls.

strings.string: ▶One starry evening, a babe was found swaddled with its mouth full of circuits by a group of baetyls in Red Rock. They took him into their fold and fostered him, and he became known as Resheph, the Coiled Lamb of Baetyls.

string.ID: At Starfarer's Quay, Resheph consulted with mysterious strangers and learned the secret of the Gyre. By cause of the misdeeds of the elder saads and sultans, star beings had levied a curse on Qud. Resheph vowed to make right from this wrong and redeem our doomed world.

strings.string: ▶At Starfarer's Quay, Resheph consulted with mysterious strangers and learned the secret of the Gyre. By cause of the misdeeds of the elder saads and sultans, star beings had levied a curse on Qud. Resheph vowed to make right from this wrong and redeem our doomed world.

string.ID: While traveling near Bethesda Susa, Resheph lost control of his chariot and drove it off a cliff. Luckily, a local physician named Rebekah came to his rescue. Moved by her kindness, Resheph enrolled at a nearby hospice as her apprentice.

strings.string: ▶While traveling near Bethesda Susa, Resheph lost control of his chariot and drove it off a cliff. Luckily, a local physician named Rebekah came to his rescue. Moved by her kindness, Resheph enrolled at a nearby hospice as her apprentice.

string.ID: In %=year=%, the Gyre widened, and the final plague afflicted the land. The Girsh Nephilim rose from their cradles on the Moon Stair and slouched toward Qud to eat its young. Resheph rose to meet them in battle and cast them back.

strings.string: ▶In %=year=%, the Gyre widened, and the final plague afflicted the land. The Girsh Nephilim rose from their cradles on the Moon Stair and slouched toward Qud to eat its young. Resheph rose to meet them in battle and cast them back.

string.ID: At twilight in the shadow of the Spindle, the people of Omonporch saw an image on the horizon that looked like a ghost bathed in cerulean. It was Resheph, and after he came and left Omonporch, the people built a monument to him, and thenceforth called him Ghost-in-Cerulean.

strings.string: ▶At twilight in the shadow of the Spindle, the people of Omonporch saw an image on the horizon that looked like a ghost bathed in cerulean. It was Resheph, and after he came and left Omonporch, the people built a monument to him, and thenceforth called him Ghost-in-Cerulean.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest dialog
string.ID: They are disciples of Barathrum. Mostly they are Urshiib, like their mentor. Mutant albino cave bears. With quills to boot! A thousand years ago Barathrum and his kin crossed the Homs Delta into the heart of Qud. He has spent centuries fiddling with the tokens of antiquity in his underground workshops.

strings.string: ▶They are disciples of Barathrum. Mostly they are Urshiib, like their mentor. Mutant albino cave bears. With quills to boot! A thousand years ago Barathrum and his kin crossed the Homs Delta into the heart of Qud. He has spent centuries fiddling with the tokens of antiquity in his underground workshops.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest choice
string.ID: I will take the disk to Grit Gate and speak with the Barathrumites.

strings.string: ▶I will take the disk to Grit Gate and speak with the Barathrumites.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest choice deny
string.ID: I must pass on this offer, for now. Live and drink.

strings.string: ▶I must pass on this offer, for now. Live and drink.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest restart dialog
string.ID:
Are you seeking more work, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Recently we came into possession of a data disk bearing a peculiar stamp and encoded with a strange signal. The signal means nothing to us, but there's a sect of tinkers called the Barathrumites who might be interested in it. They are friends to our village and often trade for the scrap we tow out of the earth. Would you carry the disk to their enclave at Grit Gate, along the western rim of the jungle? In exchange for the delivery, you might seek an apprenticeship with them.
If you are interested, take the disk now, and travel safely.
string.Value:
▶Are you seeking more work, =player.formalAddressTerm=? Recently we came into possession of a data disk bearing a peculiar stamp and encoded with a strange signal. The signal means nothing to us, but there's a sect of tinkers called the Barathrumites who might be interested in it. They are friends to our village and often trade for the scrap we tow out of the earth. Would you carry the disk to their enclave at Grit Gate, along the western rim of the jungle? In exchange for the delivery, you might seek an apprenticeship with them.
If you are interested, take the disk now, and travel safely.

string.Context: DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest choice
DynamicQuestConversationHelper village zero main quest dialog

string.ID:
Oh, you died. That's okay. It's a very common occurance in the world of Qud.
Because the tutorial drops you off in Classic mode with permadeath, your character is wiped when you die.
The good news is: you get to make a whole new character! Now with a little more knowledge than you had before.
string.Value:
▶Oh, you died. That's okay. It's a very common occurance in the world of Qud.
Because the tutorial drops you off in Classic mode with permadeath, your character is wiped when you die.
The good news is: you get to make a whole new character! Now with a little more knowledge than you had before.

string.ID:
Next time, if you want a more forgiving mode of play, try Roleplay, which lets you checkpoint at settlements.
Or try Wander mode, where most creatures are neutral to you and you gain experience via discovery instead of killing.
Or keep playing Classic if the challenge appeals to you and you'd like to explore a breadth of character types.
string.Value:
▶Next time, if you want a more forgiving mode of play, try Roleplay, which lets you checkpoint at settlements.
Or try Wander mode, where most creatures are neutral to you and you gain experience via discovery instead of killing.
Or keep playing Classic if the challenge appeals to you and you'd like to explore a breadth of character types.

string.ID: Whenever you perform the water ritual with a new creature, you gain an extra =repBonus= reputation. If you install this implant after you treat with a creature for the first time, you gain =repBonus= reputation the next time you treat with them. Reputation costs in the water ritual are reduced by =ritualCostReduction=%. You may Proselytize =proselytizeLimitBonus.things:additional creature=. Compute power on the local lattice increases this implant's effectiveness.

string.ID:
On the =day= of =month=, you arrive at the oasis-hamlet of {{green|Joppa}}, along the far rim of {{Y|Moghra'yi, the Great Salt Desert}}.
All around you, moisture farmers tend to groves of viridian watervine. There are huts wrought from rock salt and brinestalk.
On the horizon, {{r|Qud's}} jungles strangle chrome steeples and rusted archways to the earth. Further and beyond, the fabled {{C|Spindle}} rises above the fray and pierces the cloud-ribboned sky.
